body:
Getting rid of the Discord. Discord is an even worse platform than reddit where every single employee is an extreme SJW furry. It also has shady requirements, like how it now needs you to attach your phone number to not get your account banned immediately. On top of that, the corrupt staff bans a ton of people for the worst reasons, the most infamous of which is criticizing or making fun of furries (yes, *really*). I've never heard of a Discord ban getting lifted before, and seeing how banned accounts show up as deleted I doubt it's even possible for Discord to reverse one (Discord apparently doesn't hold on to deleted content like most platforms). So if someone gets banned or doesn't want to share their phone number, they can't join the Ruqqus Discord. This is very bad because right now Ruqqus literally relies on the discord for all DMs and 99% of information and announcements.

The other problem is how the admins are not communicating with users at all when it comes to how the server is set up. They have always refused to make anyone a mod of the server, nor did they ever discuss anything about their plans for the server itself outside of their private mod channel. A few weeks ago the admins finally added a few mods because the rapid influx during reddit's banwave forced them to. But now the situation is arguably even worse than before, because now the few non-admins who were modded then have a lot of control over the server, but the admins still refuse to add anyone else as a mod or discuss plans and changes for the server with anyone except those mods, meaning < 10 users have input and everyone else probably doesn't even know about what the plans are. Those mods have tried to get the admins to add other mods who showed an interest in it but they've consistently refused. The admins also claimed that they were going to make it possible to become a mod, but it's taken them way too long so I'm convinced that it's not happening.

I've never heard of a Discord ban getting lifted before, and seeing how banned accounts show up as deleted I doubt it's even possible for Discord to reverse one (Discord apparently doesn't hold on to deleted content like most platforms). So if someone gets banned or doesn't want to share their phone number, they can't join the Ruqqus Discord. This is very bad because right now Ruqqus literally relies on the discord for all DMs and 99% of information and announcements.

The other problem is how the admins are not communicating with users at all when it comes to how the server is set up. A few weeks ago the admins finally added a few mods because the rapid influx during reddit's banwave forced them to. But now the situation is arguably even worse than before, because now the few non-admins who were modded then have a lot of control over the server, but the admins still refuse to add anyone else as a mod or discuss plans and changes for the server with anyone except those mods, meaning < 10 users have input and everyone else probably doesn't even know about what the plans are. body:
I made a few suggestions in a post but didn't get a response from the dev team:

* Randomly display a couple comments at the top of the post page so new comments get a better chance of exposure (but still keep the default sort order by top)
* Add durations which increase every time a user is exiled from a guild
* Display a small indicator that the OP of the post upvoted my comment

New comments are often times not read in posts with large numbers of comments. I see this a lot on Reddit.  Many of these newer comments are great to read because their content is more diverse.  It's unfortunate they often times go unviewed and unvoted on.  Early commenters have a clear advantage for getting their comments voted up.  Also because comments are normally sorted by the most votes, there isn't so much diversity as to the top comments. **To clarify I'm suggesting the default sort order remain by top but just a couple randomly chosen comments be at the top of each post.**

It's too easy to permanently ban a user on Reddit.  A moderator shouldn't be able to easily do this as it is being used to silence people the moderator simply disagrees with.  I suggest Ruqqus look into bans with increasing lengths instead of permanently exiling users.  An example would be to use an increasing scale for ban times with the first offense leading to a 60 day ban, second offense leading to a 120 day ban, third offense leading 240 day ban, and so on.

As a frequent commenter, I always wonder if OP of the post actually upvoted my comment. I especially wonder if the OP asks a question and I take the time to write a detailed comment.  Having some sort of small indicator showing that the OP upvoted my comment would be nice.

My post:

https://ruqqus.com/post/nfq/three-suggestions-to-improve-the-ruqqus

  • Add durations which increase every time a user is exiled from a guild

Also because comments are normally sorted by the most votes, there isn't so much diversity as to the top comments. To clarify I'm suggesting the default sort order remain by top but just a couple randomly chosen comments be at the top of each post.

I suggest Ruqqus look into bans with increasing lengths instead of permanently exiling users. An example would be to use an increasing scale for ban times with the first offense leading to a 60 day ban, second offense leading to a 120 day ban, third offense leading 240 day ban, and so on.

parent.body:
Getting rid of the Discord. Discord is an even worse platform than reddit where every single employee is an extreme SJW furry. It also has shady requirements, like how it now needs you to attach your phone number to not get your account banned immediately. On top of that, the corrupt staff bans a ton of people for the worst reasons, the most infamous of which is criticizing or making fun of furries (yes, *really*). I've never heard of a Discord ban getting lifted before, and seeing how banned accounts show up as deleted I doubt it's even possible for Discord to reverse one (Discord apparently doesn't hold on to deleted content like most platforms). So if someone gets banned or doesn't want to share their phone number, they can't join the Ruqqus Discord. This is very bad because right now Ruqqus literally relies on the discord for all DMs and 99% of information and announcements.

The other problem is how the admins are not communicating with users at all when it comes to how the server is set up. They have always refused to make anyone a mod of the server, nor did they ever discuss anything about their plans for the server itself outside of their private mod channel. A few weeks ago the admins finally added a few mods because the rapid influx during reddit's banwave forced them to. But now the situation is arguably even worse than before, because now the few non-admins who were modded then have a lot of control over the server, but the admins still refuse to add anyone else as a mod or discuss plans and changes for the server with anyone except those mods, meaning < 10 users have input and everyone else probably doesn't even know about what the plans are. Those mods have tried to get the admins to add other mods who showed an interest in it but they've consistently refused. The admins also claimed that they were going to make it possible to become a mod, but it's taken them way too long so I'm convinced that it's not happening.
